summary: This document is a detailed log of psychological observations and suicide risk assessments conducted on Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July and August 2019. It chronicles his mental state, complaints about confinement, the July 23 incident where he was found with a string around his neck, and his eventual death by hanging on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the psychological observation logs. Document details his mental state, complaints, interactions, and the events leading to his death.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: The mental health professional conducting the psychological observations and suicide risk assessments on Epstein. Notes interactions and clinical findings.

persons.name: Mj.
persons.context: A staff member to whom Epstein reportedly made a statement about his cellmate trying to kill him, which he did not repeat to Dr.

connections.description: Clinical relationship between inmate and mental health professional conducting assessments and observations.
Epstein expressed fear of this cellmate after the July 23 string incident, alleging the cellmate called him a pedophile and may have been involved.
Epstein was present with this attorney during a conference where he mocked the psychologist about being placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Arrives in General Population
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at the correctional facility and is placed in General Population (GP).

events.title: Initial Intake and Psychological Observation Order
events.description: Epstein undergoes intake screening. Dr. consults with Central Office and is instructed to place Epstein on psychological observation as a precaution.

events.title: First Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Dr. conducts a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA). Epstein denies suicidality, is future-oriented, and discusses his life and case. Recommended to remain on observation.

events.title: String Incident and Placement on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein is placed on Suicide Watch (SW) after a string is found loosely around his neck. He claims not to remember the event and at one point told staff his cellmate tried to kill him.

events.title: Post Suicide Watch Report and Bail Denial
events.description: Dr. follows up. Epstein is fearful of his cellmate, reports the cellmate called him a pedophile, and states he was recently denied bail. He continues to deny suicidality.

events.title: Court Inquiry and Incident Report Expunged
events.description: A court sends a form regarding 'suicidal tendencies'. Epstein denies suicidality and reports his incident report for 'self-mutilation' from July 23 was expunged.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive and hanging in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:30 a.m., ten days after removal from constant observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (inferred from context of federal custody)
keyFacts: Epstein was placed on psychological observation and later suicide watch as a precaution, despite repeatedly and adamantly denying any suicidal thoughts or intent.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a string loosely around his neck. He had no memory of the event and gave conflicting accounts, once alleging his cellmate tried to kill him.
Epstein expressed fear of his cellmate after the July 23 incident, reporting the cellmate had called him a pedophile and was agitated.
The log notes that an incident report for 'self-mutilation' related to the July 23 string event was later expunged.
Epstein was found dead by hanging in his SHU cell on August 10, 2019, ten days after being removed from constant psychological observation status.
